title: Mumbai ferry accident: Missing body recovered, death toll rises to 14 - The Times of India
Women Need To Realise That Beneficial Laws Aren't Means To Threaten, Domineer Or Extort From Their... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Warns Against Misuse of Domestic Violence Laws by Wives

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Law

In a recent ruling, the Supreme Court cautioned women against misusing domestic violence and dowry laws, which are intended for their protection. The Court reiterated that these laws are being exploited for personal gain in matrimonial disputes.

  • The Court highlighted an alarming trend of invoking various sections of the Indian Penal Code, such as 498A and 376, as a collective strategy to pressure husbands.
  • Justices BV Nagarathna and NK Singh noted that these provisions should not be used for intimidation or extortion.
  • Minor disputes can escalate due to the misuse, leading to irreconcilable relationships.
  • The Court emphasized that criminal complaints should not serve as negotiation tools for monetary demands.
“The women need to be careful about the fact that these strict provisions of law in their hands are beneficial legislations for their welfare and not means to chastise, threaten, domineer or extort from their husbands.”

Ultimately, the Supreme Court urged for a careful and fair application of these laws to ensure they serve their intended purpose without exploitation.
newTitle: Supreme Court Warns Against Misuse of Domestic Violence Laws by Wives

summary:

“Human error was the primary cause of the crash,” sources indicate.

title: Police Case Registered Against Rahul Gandhi For "Injuring" 2 BJP MPs - NDTV
summary:
Police Case Registered Against Rahul Gandhi For Injuring 2 BJP MPs

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A police case has been registered against Rahul Gandhi after two BJP MPs sustained injuries during protests outside Parliament. The MPs are currently hospitalized, and allegations against Gandhi include various criminal charges.

  • Rahul Gandhi pushed BJP MPs, leading to injuries.
  • Former Union Minister Anurag Thakur filed the complaint.
  • Claims include attempts to murder and endangerment.
  • Congress party accused BJP of pushing and causing injuries to their leaders.
  • Protest reactions included accusations of hooliganism against Gandhi.
“It was a peaceful protest... he came in front of me and started shouting at me.” - Phangnon Konyak, BJP MP

The incident has sparked significant political tension between Congress and BJP, with both parties filing claims against one another.

title: Mayawati says Ambedkar's dignity hurt, Amit Shah must take back 'these words' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mayawati Condemns Amit Shah's Comments on Ambedkar

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a press conference, BSP chief Mayawati criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah for remarks made in the Rajya Sabha that she claims hurt the dignity of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, the architect of the Indian Constitution. She demanded Shah retract his statement and repent for the anger it has caused among Ambedkar's followers.

  • Mayawati stated that Shah's comments insulted Ambedkar and deeply affected his dignity.
  • She emphasized that there is widespread anger against Shah for his remarks.
  • Shah's comments were made during a debate on the Constitution, suggesting the Congress party exploits Ambedkar's name.
  • Shah claimed that if Congress had invoked God's name as often as Ambedkar, they would attain heaven.
“The words used by Amit Shah in the Parliament about the architect of the Indian Constitution and messiah of Dalits and other neglected classes... have greatly hurt Baba Saheb's dignity.” - Mayawati

This incident has sparked protests from various political parties and is indicative of the ongoing tensions regarding the representation and respect of Dalit icons in Indian politics.
newTitle: Mayawati Condemns Amit Shah's Comments on Ambedkar

title: ‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has entered the 24th day of his fast-unto-death, pressing the government for a legal guarantee of minimum support price (MSP) for crops. His health has deteriorated significantly, and he is now in a critical condition, at risk of cardiac arrest.

Key Points:

  • Dallewal, 70, has not eaten for 24 days as part of his protest.
  • Doctors report that his health is critical, with risks of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure.
  • The Supreme Court has criticized the Punjab government for failing to conduct timely health tests on Dallewal.
“His life is hanging by a thread.” - Doctors attending Dallewal

The situation is becoming increasingly urgent as his health continues to decline.
newTitle: Critical Condition of Farmer Leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal Amid Ongoing Fast

  • CT Ravi defended the MLC, asserting the allegations are baseless and politically motivated.
  • This incident raises concerns about political discourse and respect among party members.
“The allegations are false and meant to malign the party’s image,” said CT Ravi.

title: ‘Mukesh Rajput’s BP still high, Pratap Sarangi a cardiac patient': Doctors on injured BJP MPs - Hindustan Times
summary:
Injured BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi Hospitalized Following Parliament Scuffle

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Two BJP MPs, Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi, were admitted to RML Hospital due to injuries sustained during a scuffle outside Parliament. Doctors reported that both MPs had head injuries and were being monitored for blood pressure-related issues.

  • Both MPs admitted to RML Hospital following injuries from an altercation.
  • Doctors stated that both sustained head injuries and have high blood pressure concerns.
  • Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited the MPs and reported that they would remain in the hospital for observation.
  • Ajay Shukla, the Medical Superintendent, provided updates on their conditions.
  • The incident has sparked political tensions, with BJP and Congress filing complaints against each other.
“Rajput ji's blood pressure is still high. We are doing our best possible.” – Dr. Ajay Shukla

The condition of the MPs requires careful observation following a violent confrontation that underscores ongoing political tensions.

title: BJP MLC C T Ravi arrested for 'derogatory' remarks against Karnataka minister Laxmi Hebbalkar - Deccan Herald
summary:
BJP MLC C T Ravi Arrested for Derogatory Remarks Against Karnataka Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar

Published: 19 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

Senior BJP lawmaker C T Ravi was arrested in Belagavi after being accused of making derogatory comments about Women & Child Development Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar during a legislative session.

  • Ravi was arrested on charges of sexual harassment and insulting the modesty of a woman based on a complaint lodged by Hebbalkar.
  • Supporters of Hebbalkar attempted to attack Ravi, leading to police intervention.
  • The altercation ensued after heated exchanges between Congress and BJP members in the Legislative Council.
  • Ravi denied making the remarks and suggested an investigation of video evidence.
  • BJP leaders defended Ravi, questioning the timing of Hebbalkar's complaint.
“This House has always respected women. I've not come across such words being used in my long career.” - Council chairperson Basavaraj Horatti

The incident highlights ongoing tensions within Karnataka’s political landscape as accusations of misconduct are scrutinized amidst party rivalries.
newTitle: BJP MLC C T Ravi Arrested for Derogatory Remarks Against Minister

summary:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Cong president Kharge accuses BJP of ‘pre-planned conspiracy’

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parliament Winter Session is nearing its end amid rising tensions over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Dr. BR Ambedkar. Opposition parties are demanding his resignation, while Congress's Mallikarjun Kharge has accused the BJP of orchestrating a distraction to shift focus from these comments.

  • High drama unfolded during the session as opposition MPs protested against Amit Shah's remarks.
  • Two BJP MPs reported injuries related to pushing by Congress members during the protest.
  • Congress plans a nationwide protest demanding Shah's resignation, with Kharge urging PM Modi to act swiftly.
  • Claims of a conspiracy by the BJP to disrupt opposition protests have been voiced by several Congress leaders.
“Every Indian who believes in social justice will fight against BJP’s oppressive tyranny and Manuvadi mindset!” - Mallikarjun Kharge

The ongoing conflict highlights deep political divisions and the challenge of maintaining decorum within parliamentary proceedings.

summary:
Opposition's No-Confidence Motion Against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Dismissed

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: News18

Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh dismissed a no-confidence motion against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, stating it was flawed and an attempt to damage his reputation.

  • The motion was submitted by at least 60 opposition members on December 10.
  • Harivansh described the impeachment notice as a “misadventure” aimed at trivializing the constitutional office of the Vice President.
  • Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticized the ruling, saying it misrepresented facts from a recent press conference.
The ruling given by the Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha today on the motion of no confidence in the Chairman submitted by INDIA parties contains a reference to some remarks made by me in a press conference held on Dec 12, 2024. This reference takes liberties with facts – to… pic.twitter.com/2DFWa5z1V6— Jairam Ramesh (@Jairam_Ramesh) December 19, 2024

Harivansh's ruling was aimed at preserving the dignity of Parliament amidst the targeted allegations against Dhankhar.

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis expresses support for Ajit Pawar's dreams of becoming Chief Minister during a legislative assembly session.

“You are called 'permanent deputy CM'... but my wishes are with you... you will be the Chief Minister someday.” - Devendra Fadnavis

title: 'Blot On Constitutional Spirit' : Supreme Court Aghast At Attack & Disrobing Of Woman Over Witchcraft... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Shocked by Public Disrobing of Woman Accused of Witchcraft

Publication Date: October 31, 2023

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed its astonishment at a case involving the public disrobing and abuse of a woman labeled as a witch. The Court highlighted the severity of such acts in modern society and emphasized the importance of human dignity.

  • The incident occurred in March 2020 in Bihar, where 13 individuals were accused of physically assaulting a woman and her grandmother over witchcraft allegations.
  • The Supreme Court criticized the lack of action by the State in addressing the stay order granted by the Patna High Court.
  • The judges stressed that human dignity is crucial to the constitutional framework and condemned the targeting of women with witchcraft allegations.
  • In 2022, 85 cases related to witchcraft were reported in India, alongside a troubling trend of disrobing cases.
“Dignity goes to the very core of the existence of an individual in society. Any action which undermines dignity...is potentially going against the spirit of the Constitution.”

The Supreme Court reiterated the necessity for legislative and societal changes to protect women's rights and dignity. It ended the session by instructing the Trial Court to expedite the trial process.
newTitle: Supreme Court Shocked by Public Disrobing of Woman Accused of Witchcraft

title: Protests, scuffles and FIRs: How row over Amit Shah's Ambedkar remark took a violent turn in Parliament - The Times of India
Nine Jharkhand officers to become IAS without appearing for UPSC exam; here's how - DNA India
summary:
Nine Jharkhand Officers to Become IAS Without UPSC Exam

Publication Date: December 2024, Source: DNA India

The Jharkhand government is set to promote nine senior JAS officers to IAS cadre without requiring them to appear for the UPSC Civil Services Exam, following their recommendation by the state.

  • Promotion applies to all vacancies pertaining to 2023.
  • A panel of eligible JAS officers was prepared by the Jharkhand government.
  • 27 names were recommended to the UPSC for consideration.
  • A meeting took place between state officials and the UPSC in New Delhi.
  • The proposal will be sent to the Ministry of Personnel, Government of India.
“Becoming an IAS officer is a dream for many as the prestigious job provides many opportunities to do the welfare of society.”

This initiative underscores the state's commitment to recognizing dedicated service among its administrative officers, paving new pathways for civil service advancement.
newTitle: Nine Jharkhand Officers to Become IAS Without UPSC Exam

title: Bangladesh National Among 8 Arrested For Plan To Target RSS, Hindu Groups, Says Assam STF - NDTV
Case filed against KTR over Rs 45-crore payment to hold Formula E race in Hyderabad - The Indian Express
summary:
Case Filed Against KTR Over Rs 45-Crore Payment for Formula E Race in Hyderabad

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Telangana’s Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has filed a case against K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), over alleged irregularities related to the Formula E racing event held in Hyderabad.

  • KTR is accused of authorizing payments without proper Cabinet clearance.
  • Rs 45 crore was allegedly paid to the Formula E Organisers in violation of RBI guidelines.
  • The ACB's investigation followed a fine imposed by the RBI on the Telangana government for unauthorized transactions.
  • The FIR includes charges under the Prevention of Corruption Act, IPC sections 409 (criminal breach of trust), and 120B (criminal conspiracy).
  • KTR has denied any wrongdoing, stating that the event aimed to enhance Hyderabad's global image.
“I am willing to go to jail if anything illegal is found. I will use the jail time to stay fit and plan a padayatra.” - K T Rama Rao

This case raises significant issues regarding governance and transparency in public spending during high-profile events.
newTitle: Case Filed Against KTR Over Rs 45-Crore Payment for Formula E Race in Hyderabad

'How Can You Ask Elephants To Keep 3 Meter Distance? Kerala High Court's Directions Impractical': Supreme ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Questions Kerala High Court's Elephant Distance Rule

Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has stayed the Kerala High Court's restriction mandating a 3-meter distance between elephants during temple festivals, citing impracticality and a lack of violation complaints.

  • The Supreme Court intervened to stay the Kerala High Court’s directions regarding elephants in temple festivals.
  • High Court's direction for a three-meter distance between elephants was deemed impractical.
  • Justice Nagarathna stated that animal rights should not disrupt existing customs.
  • The Supreme Court emphasized compliance with existing rules from 2012 regarding captive elephant management.
  • Concerns were raised about the monitoring of a 250-year-old festival and its cultural significance.
“How do you expect the elephant to maintain 3 meters distance? Practically impossible.” - Justice BV Nagarathna

The Supreme Court's decision highlights the need for balance between traditional practices and animal welfare laws, emphasizing the importance of adhering to existing regulations while considering the cultural significance of festivals.
newTitle: Supreme Court Questions Kerala High Court's Elephant Distance Rule

PM Modi Contacts Injured BJP MPs Amid Parliament Tensions

Source: News18

After two BJP MPs were injured during a confrontation with opposition MPs in Parliament, PM Modi reached out to inquire about their health, highlighting the tensions surrounding recent protests.

  • PM Modi called BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput after they were injured during jostling in Parliament.
  • Dr. Ajay Shukla confirmed the PM’s inquiry into the MPs' conditions.
  • Mallikarjun Kharge alleged he was injured due to physical interactions with BJP MPs.
  • Congress MPs claimed Rahul Gandhi was also manhandled during the incident.
  • The situation escalated as both NDA and INDIA bloc MPs protested over the Ambedkar issue, leading to the injuries.
“He spoke with both of them and tried to make them understand to not worry and that they would be fine.” - Dr. Ajay Shukla

title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: BJP MP accuses Rahul Gandhi of misbehaving with her - Hindustan Times
Delhi Air Pollution: Supreme Court orders NCR states to constitute teams to enforce GRAP measures - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi Air Pollution: Supreme Court orders NCR states to constitute teams to enforce GRAP measures

Published on: 19 Dec 2024, 10:48 am

The Supreme Court has directed states in the National Capital Region (NCR) to form teams to enforce anti-pollution measures under Stage 4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) due to deteriorating air quality.

  • The Supreme Court issued the order after GRAP IV was reinstated because of worsening conditions.
  • State teams will consist of police and revenue officials to monitor compliance and report any breaches.
  • The Court is also reviewing actions by authorities in adjoining states regarding stubble-burning incidents.
  • On December 12, the Court mandated NCR states to reach a consensus on the prohibition of firecrackers.
  • Delhi has implemented a total ban on firecrackers, while Haryana permits only green crackers and Rajasthan has imposed a complete ban in the NCR areas.
  • The effectiveness of the firecracker ban relies on uniform decisions from all NCR states.
“For the time being, we direct Uttar Pradesh and Haryana to impose similar ban which is imposed by Delhi.”

The Supreme Court's decision underscores the urgency to tackle air pollution in NCR by ensuring unified efforts across state lines.
newTitle: Supreme Court Orders NCR States to Enforce Anti-Pollution Measures
